comments:
i inherited a project which contains at least one file with about 10.000 lines.
while the file itself is bad design at least in respect to its size, i noticed that pdt does not handle such large files very well:
- outline does not work
- completion does not work (neither auto nor with keys)
- "open declaration" yields repeatedly errors about "not completing normally (NPE)"
- "undo" yields repeatedly errors about "not completing normally (NPE)"
there are probably much more.

there isn't any, at least now.
i discovered that at least outline and completion work after a while -- so obviously the parsing takes a lot of time.
"open declaration" is bit tricky:
i got a method in my class which is named like a method from another class i call inside, e g

1: function foo()
2: {
3:     $db->foo();
4: }
pressing F3 on foo() of line three jumps to line 1, instead of the line in the class of $db, oddly enough, it does not reset --- marking a completely different function-call F3 still jumps to line 1 of the above example.

only after closing and reopening of the file F3 tries to open the right declaration in that cloass with 10,000+ lines and creates the log-entry below:
